intro: Carphobolus tereticaulis, commonly known as the slender burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces distinctive, spiny seed heads that aid in wind and animal dispersal. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and soil stabilization efforts.
